intro: Leucas orbicularis, commonly known as the broadleaf leucas, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
